title: Definition of Significant and Ethical
text: Significance refers to statistical outcomes rather than structure. Ethicality additionally does not refer to an instrument's structure, and is regarding to the ethics or morals of the situation.

title: Definition of Deductive and Confidential
text: Deductive reasoning refers to the logical process of drawing conclusions and confidentiality refers to protecting an individuals privacy.

title: Definition of Correlational and Probabilistic
text: These terms describe types of research or statistical relationships

title: Definition of Reliable and Valid
text: A reliable instrument is one that is dependable to produce accurate results. Validity refers to whether the instrument is useful.

title: Judging Instrument Quality
text: Consider what qualities make an instrument sound and trustworthy. What characteristics ensure it measures correctly and consistently?
